subject: Languages
title: Grammaticalization: Content Words Become Grammar
description: One-minute skill: Grammaticalization: Content Words Become Grammar.

hook.text: The English word 'will' used to mean 'want.' Now it just marks the future tense. That transformation has a name.

buildup.text: Grammaticalization is when a meaningful word fades into a grammar marker over centuries.

discovery.text: French 'pas' (meaning 'step') became a negation marker: 'ne... pas' originally meant 'not a step.'

twist.text: This process is one-directional â€” grammar words almost never become content words again.

climax.text: Grammaticalization explains how languages keep rebuilding their grammar from their own vocabulary.

punchline.text: Today's grammar was yesterday's vocabulary. Languages recycle their own words.

quiz.question: What is grammaticalization?
options: A content word gradually becoming a grammar marker
